New Records: Lars Nootbaar hit a solo home run in the seventh inning, his first against a left-handed pitcher this season, giving him 10 home runs for the season.
The St. Louis Cardinals fell below.500 (74-75) with 13 games remaining in the season.
Key Match Events: The Toronto Blue Jays scored the deciding run in the eighth inning when pinch hitter George Springer singled against Cardinals setup man Andrew Kittredge, and then Nathan Lukes hit an opposite-field RBI double that scored Springer and broke a tie score.
Lars Nootbaar went deep with a solo home run in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The loss left the Cardinals below.500 and ended their three-game series against the Blue Jays with a sweep.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Blue Jays starters had the best ERA in the majors since August, and Yariel Rodriguez allowed just one run in his previous eight innings.
The Cardinals went 0 for 5 with runners in scoring position and left six men on base.
